author: Eric Martin
description: The US will seek agreements with eight allied nations as part of a fresh effort to strengthen supply chains for the computer chips and critical minerals needed for AI technology, according to the top State Department official for economic affairs.
title: US Moves to Deepen Minerals Supply Chain in AI Race With China

author: Jennifer A Dlouhy
description: President Donald Trump on Monday signed into law a measure authorizing billions of dollars in federal funding to help prevent drug overdoses and aid patients recovering from addiction, according to the White House.
title: Trump Signs Law to Unlock Billions for Drug Addiction Recovery

author: Ellen Milligan
description: The UK will adopt a more pro-business approach to China but not trade its national security for greater trade ties, Keir Starmer said as he sought to clarify his Labour administration’s approach to the Asian nation.
title: Starmer Says UK Will Adopt Pro-Business Approach With Beijing

author: Nathan R Dean
description: Extension of Affordable Care Act subsidies is still in limbo.
title: Congress Is Running Out the Clock on Any Big Moves by Year’s End

author: Brian Platt
description: Prime Minister Mark Carney has named Marc Miller, Canada’s former immigration minister, to cabinet to replace Steven Guilbeault after he quit last week over the government’s energy pact with Alberta.
title: Carney Taps Ex-Immigration Minister Miller to Replace Guilbeault

author: Hadriana Lowenkron, Patricia Hurtado
description: President Donald Trump has freed GPB Capital Holdings LLC founder David Gentile, who was sentenced to seven years in prison for a fraud scheme that put at risk more than $1 billion of investor funds.
title: Trump Commutes Sentence of GPB Capital Founder David Gentile

author: Michael D McDonald
description: The quick count in Honduras’ presidential election resulted in a technical tie with just 515 votes separating the leading candidates, according to the nation’s electoral authority.
title: Honduras to Start Close Count With Leading Candidates Tied

author: Laura Dhillon Kane
description: Canada has reached a deal to join the European Union’s €150 billion ($174 billion) military procurement fund, the country’s defense minister said, though the access fee has yet to be announced.
title: Canada Reaches Deal to Join EU’s Flagship Defense Program

author: Skylar Woodhouse
description: Donald Trump received a “preventative” MRI of his heart and abdomen that showed “normal” organ functions, the White House said amid mounting questions about the 79-year-old president’s health.
title: Trump Had ‘Preventative’ MRI of Heart, Abdomen, White House Says

author: Slav Okov
description: The biggest protest in more than a decade took place in Bulgaria’s capital on Monday as tens of thousands of people gathered in Sofia to protest the government’s 2026 budget plans. Political tensions have risen in recent months and are taking on even greater weight as the Balkan country prepares to adopt the euro in January.
title: Thousands Rally Across Bulgaria Against Cabinet’s Budget Plans

author: Courtney McBride
description: The White House confirmed the US military ordered a second strike against a suspected drug-trafficking vessel in the Caribbean Sea in September, but insisted it was a lawful use of force.
title: White House Confirms Second Strike on Alleged Drug Boat

author: Zoe Tillman, Jaewon Kang
description: Costco Wholesale Corp. joined a fast-growing list of businesses suing the Trump administration to ensure eligibility for refunds if the US Supreme Court strikes down the president’s signature global tariffs policy.
title: Costco Joins Companies Suing for Refunds If Trump’s Tariffs Fall

author: Michelle Kaske
description: New York Governor Kathy Hochul is doubling the state’s investment for expanding child-care facilities to $100 million in 2026.
title: Hochul Doubles Child-Care Facility Funds to $100 Million in 2026

author: Allyson Versprille, Myles Miller
description: US flyers arriving at the airport without a REAL ID will be offered the option to pay $45 for an alternative process to prove their identities, Transportation Security Administration officials said Monday.
title: US Flyers Without REAL ID Will Be Able to Pay $45 to Bypass Rule

author: Bob Van Voris
description: One of the four sons of imprisoned drug kingpin Joaquin “El Chapo” Guzman, is set to change his not guilty plea in a case charging him in a drug trafficking conspiracy, according to court documents.
title: El Chapo’s Son to Change Plea in Drug Trafficking Prosecution

author: Khalid Al Ansary
description: Iraq plans to invite a select group of major US oil companies for direct negotiations over the acquisition of Lukoil PJSC’s stake in the giant West Qurna-2 oil field, as Baghdad accelerates efforts to reshape ownership of one of its key energy assets.
title: Iraq Courts US Firms for Lukoil Stake Amid Washington Support

author: Tom Rees
description: The head of the UK’s Office for Budget Responsibility resigned on Monday after the fiscal watchdog accidentally leaked the contents of Rachel Reeves’ crucial budget just before the chancellor was due to unveil her plans in front of Parliament.
title: Head of UK Budget Watchdog Resigns After Reeves’ Budget Leaked

author: Jessica Nix
description: Health and Human Services Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. has named Martin Kulldorff to a senior advisory role within the agency, elevating an anti-establishment scientist who co-wrote a manifesto against lockdowns at the height of the pandemic and said he was fired from Harvard Medical School for refusing to get a Covid shot.
title: RFK Jr. Names Controversial Vaccine Advisor to Senior HHS Role

author: Jennifer A Dlouhy, Galit Altstein
description: US President Donald Trump encouraged Israel to maintain a dialogue with Syria after a deadly military operation on the border further strained relations between the two nations.
title: Trump Urges Israel, Syria Talks After Clash Deepens Rift

author: Michael D McDonald
description: The candidate backed by Donald Trump in the Honduran presidential election is holding onto a wafer-thin lead over a man the US leader attacked as a “borderline communist.”
title: Trump-Backed Candidate Sees Lead Shrink in Honduras Vote Count

author: Andrea Palasciano, Max Ramsay
description: The European Union’s top diplomat expressed concern that US attempts to push Ukraine into a lopsided peace plan would only encourage Russia’s warmongering as Kyiv’s allies brace themselves for a key week of talks to end Moscow’s invasion.
title: EU Warns US Against Pressuring Ukraine Over Russia on Peace Plan

author: Joe Mayes
description: The UK’s fiscal watchdog, the Office for Budget Responsibility, blamed its own leadership for an error that led to the early disclosure of its budget analysis before Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves delivered last week’s statement.
title: UK’s OBR Blames Shock Early Budget Report On Its Own Leaders

author: Lauren Rosenthal, Zahra Hirji
description: The Federal Emergency Management Agency has ordered a group of employees to return to work after placing them on leave in August — and later dismissing one — for publicly raising concerns about the agency’s disaster-response capabilities.
title: FEMA Orders Staff Back After Whistleblower Letter Probe Ends

author: David Voreacos, Celine Castronuovo
description: Alina Habba, President Donald Trump’s pick to be the top US prosecutor in New Jersey was not lawfully appointed to the job, a federal appeals court ruled.
title: Alina Habba Blocked as New Jersey US Attorney by Appeals Court

author: Ashleigh Furlong, Lucy White
description: The UK is set to announce a pharmaceutical deal with President Donald Trump that includes tariff-free imports to the US, as well as a significant reduction in rebates paid by drugmakers to the National Health Service.
title: UK to Agree Drug Pricing Deal With US, Cut Rebates Paid to NHS

author: Donato Paolo Mancini, Alessandra Migliaccio
description: Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni is facing criticism from opposition lawmakers over the government’s role in an alleged market-manipulation scheme related to Banca Monte dei Paschi di Siena SpA’s €17 billion ($19.8 billion) takeover of Mediobanca SpA.
title: Meloni Faces Opposition Criticism for ‘Rigging’ Paschi Deal

author: Alaric Nightingale
description: Ukraine carried out record attacks on strategic oil infrastructure in Russia last month as the US attempts to broker a peace deal to end the near four-year war.
title: Ukraine Carries Out Record Attacks on Russia Oil Infrastructure

author: Antony Sguazzin
description: A South African court remanded a female state-radio presenter and four men in custody until a Dec. 8 bail hearing after they were charged with contravening the country’s laws against assisting foreign military forces.
title: South Africa Remands Radio DJ Over Alleged Russian Military Work

author: Andrea Palasciano
description: Ukraine is seeking some €1 billion ($1.2 billion) in additional European funding by the end of the year to finance US weapons purchases, the country’s ambassador to NATO said.
title: Ukraine Seeks €1 Billion More to Buy US Weapons by Year-End

author: Christine Burke
description: Saudi Arabia has more than three dozen companies seeking approval to list shares locally as the kingdom presses ahead with reforms to deepen its financial markets and draw more foreign investors.
title: Saudis Tout ‘Vibrant’ IPO Pipeline Ahead of More Market Reforms

author: Alex Morales
description: Prime Minister Keir Starmer defended his chancellor, Rachel Reeves, saying she didn’t mislead voters and fellow cabinet members about the state of the UK’s public finances in the run-up to last week’s budget.
title: Starmer Says Reeves Didn’t Mislead UK Public Ahead of Budget

description: US leader’s weekend moves look like a prelude to something more muscular against Maduro’s regime.
title: Trump’s Net Tightens Around Maduro’s Venezuela

author: Carolina Gonzalez
description: Investors in Chile are already looking beyond the presidential runoff this month, confident it will usher in the most right-wing government in 35 years, but concerned the new administration will struggle to deliver on its promises.
title: Chile Investors Start to Query What Happens After Kast Wins

author: Zoltan Simon
description: Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban said he’s ready to throw a financial lifeline to Budapest, where the opposition leadership blames the government’s tax policies for pushing the capital city to the brink of insolvency.
title: Budapest Assembly Meets on Insolvency as Hungary’s Orban Offers Lifeline

author: Cliff Harvey Venzon
description: The Philippines deferred the awarding of a project that’s part of a plan to build one of the world’s longest marine bridges after local opposition over the potential involvement of a Chinese company due to national security fears.
title: Philippines Delays Award of Key Bridge Project Amid China Risk

author: Pathom Sangwongwanich
description: Thailand’s government on Monday announced fresh relief measures for victims of one of the country’s worst floods in decades, weeks ahead of an expected call for snap elections.
title: Floods Become Test for Thailand’s Premier Ahead of Elections

author: Felix Tam, Twinnie Siu
description: Authorities found Hong Kong’s deadly blaze was accelerated by workers using cheaper substandard netting and evading government testing, as police said the death toll has risen to 151.
title: Hong Kong’s Deadly Fire Fueled by Substandard Netting, Officials Say

author: Ashleigh Furlong, Jason Gale
description: The UN agency that responds to Ebola outbreaks and other health emergencies is in turmoil. But its leaders say it could emerge stronger.
title: Trump’s Assault on the WHO Is Forcing Radical Reform

author: Christine Burke
description: Saudi Arabia’s sovereign wealth fund is looking to increase its investments in Japan to about $27 billion by the end of 2030 as the kingdom looks to deepen ties in Asia and expand in areas from critical minerals to financial markets.
title: Saudi Wealth Fund Plans to More Than Double Investments in Japan

author: Heidi Taksdal Skjeseth
description: Norway’s Labor government is racing to avert a full-blown government crisis after budget talks broke down ahead of a crucial vote due on Friday.
title: Norway Battles Budget Crisis as Climate, Welfare Spark Standoff

author: Greg Sullivan
description: Russian President Vladimir Putin signed an order to allow visa-free entry into the country for Chinese citizens as ties between the two nations continue to deepen.
title: Putin Allows Visa-Free Entry for Chinese Citizens Into Russia

author: Zoe Schneeweiss, Mark Schroers, Daniel Basteiro
description: European Central Bank Vice President Luis de Guindos extolled the virtues of fellow Spaniard Pablo Hernandez de Cos but declined to say if that put him on track to succeed Christine Lagarde as ECB president in two years.
title: Guindos Says De Cos Was Excellent Governor, But No Lock for Lagarde’s ECB Job

author: Arun Devnath
description: A court in Bangladesh sentenced former UK City Minister Tulip Siddiq in absentia to two years in prison in a case involving property deals with her aunt, the deposed prime minister Sheikh Hasina.
title: Bangladesh Court Sentences Ex-UK Minister Siddiq to Two Years

author: Julian Lee
description: Two supertankers have begun hauling crude on a lengthy and unusual voyage from Guyana to India, as refiners in the South Asian nation snap up alternatives to sanctioned Russian crude.
title: Guyanese Oil on Long Voyage to India to Replace Russian Barrels

author: Ram Anand
description: Malaysian Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim said a major revamp of the cabinet is unnecessary given that his administration doesn’t have much more than a year to run.
title: Malaysia’s Anwar to Fill Cabinet Gaps But Major Shuffle Unneeded

author: Dan Murtaugh, Ocean Hou
description: A major solar panel manufacturer is transferring the assets of its Chinese unit to Canadian ownership, to safeguard sales into the US as Washington steps up scrutiny of imports from the Asian nation.
title: Canadian Solar Transfers Assets to Avoid US Scrutiny on China

author: Philip Heijmans
description: Singapore will bar the use of smartphones and smartwatches in secondary schools starting in January, as countries debate how to curb children’s access to digital devices.
title: Singapore to Curb Students’ Smartphone Use During School Hours

author: Yian Lee
description: Taiwan plans to buy its first weapons for a major air-defense system announced less than two months ago, underscoring Taipei’s urgency to get the program online as China escalates its military intimidation.
title: Taiwan Plans First Weapons Purchases for T-Dome to Counter China

author: Anusha Ondaatjie
description: Sri Lanka is setting up a fund to repair damage from Cyclone Ditwah as the island nation faces its “largest and most challenging natural disaster,” President Anura Kumara Dissanayake said.
title: Sri Lanka Plans Fund to Rebuild From Worst Storms in About 20 Years
